sentence: This tool is called a compass.

comms_internal: Не уверен, что это можно считать переходной конструкцией, но выглядит именно так (He is short one euro). JN: LACK:    "is short" is probably most neutral and frequent, but maybe colloquial (and maybe mostly American?).

sentence: No, my shirt is different from yours.

comms_internal: See a separate file for the clarification of the structure.

Вообще-то это Николс предложила в качестве первого варианта like. Вторая возможность -- of, которая была раньше у меня. В гугле like раза в 3 чаще. JN: Some people can also say "smell of".  Maybe include that as an alternative.

sentence: Peter melted a piece of lead.
This belt goes well with my dress.
The carpet covers the whole floor.
Peter remembers the house where he grew up well.

sentence: Peter cut himself with a razor.
The glass got stuck to the table.
Peter was glad about the letter.
comms_internal: JN: Еще вариант (P. was glad to get the letter). REJOICE:    This is archaic (mostly Biblical).  Phrasal alternatives also include "happy to see", "happy to get"

sentence: Mary gave birth to a son.
Peter got down from the horse.
The honey got mixed with the milk.
Peter is looking at the clouds.
Peter had a quarrel with Mary.
Peter poured the sugar into the cup.
The log sank in the water.
Peter is squeamish about dirty dishes.
Peter is ok with his son.
comms_internal: JN. Спросить, получается, что нет способа спросить? Actually, I think "content" and "satisfied" are both better with inanimate and abstract objects:  content or satisfied with his son's performance.  Content or satisfied with an employee, maybe (but then it's really their work and not the person).   In quite colloquial English, but rapidly becoming neutral:  P is OK with his son.  (Probably not British, at least not yet.)

sentence: Peter fell in love with Mary.
Peter was surprised at this gift.
comms_internal: JN. добавила at первым, после слэша осталось by, которое было у меня. Спросить.

sentence: Peter wants a new mobile phone.
Peter has a grudge against Mary.

comms_internal: CV. JN добавила варианты (P got mad at / cross with M.)
JN: "marvel at" exists but is a bit poetic.  There's really no close equivalent in English.

sentence: Peter got upset with his son.
comms_internal: CV. Видимо, возможно и became upset because of his son (было у меня, JN заменила через слэш)

sentence: Peter is getting irritated with his daughter.
